cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles WSW of Negril, Jamaica and 130 miles SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, traverse the central Gulf of Mexico Saturday, and head toward the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near the Mississippi River Delta (around Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, with greatest risk along southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are probable by Sunday morning with a growing chance of hurricane-force gusts as the system nears landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast guidance and NHC key messages highlight the potential for a dangerous storm surge of several feet along southeast Louisiana, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands associated with the cyclone could easily exceed 4â€“8 inches over Plaquemines Parish, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and large breaking waves in the Lower Mississippi River approaches; possible river flooding upriver after landfall.
